etymologies: modern Latin, named after Johann H. von Heucher (1677–1747), German botanist

definitions: a North American plant with dark green round or heart-shaped leaves and slender stems of tiny flowers.

notes.text: Genus Heuchera, family Saxifragaceae: many species, including the white-flowered alpine heuchera (H. glabra) of the Pacific Northwest. See also alumroot, coral bells

shortDefinitions: North American plant with dark green round or heart-shaped leaves
